recipe_text: Quantity; 680; Prepare 680 grams of chicken breast, cut into pieces| Quantity; 150; Prepare 150 grams of onion, chopped| Measurement; 10; Measure out 10 grams of garlic, minced| Measurement; 10; Measure out 10 grams of ginger, minced| Measurement; 400; Measure out 400 grams of tomatoes, chopped| Measurement; 240; Measure out 240 grams of yogurt| Measurement; 30; Measure out 30 grams of vegetable oil| Measurement; 15; Measure out 15 grams of curry powder| Measurement; 5; Measure out 5 grams of turmeric| Measurement; 2; Measure out 2 grams of cayenne pepper| Measurement; 5; Measure out 5 grams of salt| Measurement; 240; Measure out 240 grams of water| Measurement; 5; Measure out 5 grams of cilantro, chopped| Untimed; None; Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat| Untimed; None; Add onion, garlic, and ginger to the skillet and cook until softened| Untimed; None; Stir in curry powder, turmeric, cayenne pepper, and salt| Untimed; None; Add chicken pieces and cook until browned| Untimed; None; Stir in tomatoes and yogurt| Untimed; None; Pour in water and bring to a boil| Timed; 1800; Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally| Untimed; None; Garnish with chopped cilantro| Finish; None; Serve hot!
title: Indian Chicken Curry II
